Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.client

Class SMTPClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.Connector
      • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.Client
        • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.client.SMTPClient
  • public class SMTPClient
extends Client
    SMTP client implementation that creates and manages SMTP client connections.

    This class extends Client to provide SMTP-specific client functionality for connecting to SMTP servers and creating connection instances.

    Standalone Usage

    
 SMTPClient client = new SMTPClient("smtp.example.com", 587);
 client.connect(new ServerGreeting() {
     public void handleGreeting(SMTPSession session) {
         session.ehlo("myhostname", new EhloHandler());
     }
     // ... other callbacks
 });

    Server Integration (with SelectorLoop affinity)

    
 // Use the same SelectorLoop as your server connection
 SMTPClient client = new SMTPClient(connection.getSelectorLoop(), "smtp.example.com", 587);
 client.connect(handler);

    The handler passed to connect() must implement ServerGreeting to receive the server's initial greeting and begin the SMTP session.

    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    ServerGreeting

    • Constructor Detail

      • SMTPClient

        public SMTPClient​(java.lang.String host,
                  int port)
           throws java.net.UnknownHostException
        Creates an SMTP client that will connect to the specified host and port.

        The Gumdrop infrastructure is managed automatically - it starts when Client.connect(T) is called and stops when all connections close.

        Parameters:
        host - the SMTP server host as a String
        port - the SMTP server port number (typically 25, 465, or 587)
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if the host cannot be resolved

      • SMTPClient

        public SMTPClient​(SelectorLoop selectorLoop,
                  java.lang.String host,
                  int port)
           throws java.net.UnknownHostException
        Creates an SMTP client that will connect to the specified host and port, using the provided SelectorLoop for I/O.

        Use this constructor for server integration where you want the client to share a SelectorLoop with server connections for efficiency.

        Parameters:
        selectorLoop - the SelectorLoop for connection I/O
        host - the SMTP server host as a String
        port - the SMTP server port number (typically 25, 465, or 587)
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if the host cannot be resolved

    • Method Detail

      • isChunkingEnabled

        public boolean isChunkingEnabled()
        Returns whether BDAT (CHUNKING) is enabled.

        When enabled (default), the client will use the BDAT command instead of DATA if the server advertises CHUNKING support. BDAT is more efficient as it doesn't require dot-stuffing and allows the server to process chunks as they arrive.

        Returns:
        true if CHUNKING is enabled

      • setChunkingEnabled

        public void setChunkingEnabled​(boolean enabled)
        Sets whether to use BDAT (CHUNKING) when the server supports it.

        When enabled (default), the client will use the BDAT command instead of DATA if the server advertises CHUNKING support. Disable this for testing or when connecting to servers with buggy CHUNKING implementations.

        Parameters:
        enabled - true to enable CHUNKING, false to always use DATA

      • newConnection

        protected Connection newConnection​(java.nio.channels.SocketChannel channel,
                                   javax.net.ssl.SSLEngine engine,
                                   ClientHandler handler)
        Creates a new SMTP client connection with a handler.

        The handler must implement ServerGreeting to receive the server's initial greeting and begin the SMTP session.

        Specified by:
        newConnection in class Client
        Parameters:
        channel - the socket channel for the connection
        engine - optional SSL engine for secure connections
        handler - the client handler (must be ServerGreeting)
        Returns:
        a new SMTPClientConnection instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if handler is not a ServerGreeting
